association.ja: SRIMC(synthesis and Reactinity in Inorganic and Metal-organic Chemistry)

description.ja: SRIMC(synthesis and Reactinity in Inorganic and Metal-organic Chemistry)

paper_title.en: Preparation and structural properties of novel fluorenophanes

description.en: All kinds of fluorenophanes with bridging at 1,7-, 1,8-, and 2,7-positions of each fluorene unit have been successfully prepared. Dynamic structural properties clearly depend on the positions of the bridges. It has been found out that one (2,7)-bridged fluorene ring in the [2.2](1,8)(2,7)fluorenophane is bent to result in formation of the pi-cavity.

paper_title.en: Preparation and structural properties of novel fluorenophanes

description.en: All kinds of fluorenophanes with bridging at 1,7-, 1,8-, and 2,7-positions of each fluorene unit have been successfully prepared. paper_title.ja: Syntheses, characterization and crystal structures of diamine-bridged dinuclear 5,14-dihydro-6,8,15,17-tetramethyldibengo [b,i][1,4,8,11]tetraazacycloteradecinatozine(Ⅱ) complexes
paper_title.en: Syntheses, characterization and crystal structures of diamine-bridged dinuclear 5,14-dihydro-6,8,15,17-tetramethyldibenzo[b,i][1,4,8,11]tetraazacyclotetradecinatoznc(II) complexes

description.en: A N,N,N',N'-tetramethylethylenediamine (TEMED)-bridged dinuclear tmtaa zinc(II) complex, Zn(tmtaa)(mu-TEMED)(tmtaa)Zn (1) (H(2)tmtaa = 5,14-dihydro-6,8,15,17-tetramethyldibenzo[b,i][1,4,8,11]tetraazacyclotetradecine), a N,N-dimethylethylenediamine (DEMED)-bridged dinuclear tmtaa zinc(II) complex, Zn(tmtaa)(mu-DEMED)(tmtaa)Zn (2) and an ethylenediamine (EDA)bridged dinuclear tmtaa zinc(II) complex, Zn(tmtaa)(mu-EDA)(tmtaa)Zn (3), were prepared by the reactions of Zn(CF3SO3)(2), H(2)tmtaa and TEMED. DEMED or EDA in acetonitrile. 1, 2 and 3 have been characterized by IR spectra, UV spectra, mass spectra, NMR spectra and elemental analyses, as well as DSC measurements. Crystal structures of 1 and 2 were determined by X-ray diffraction. The structures reveal that 1 and 2 are dinuclear tmtaa zinc(II) complexes bridged with TEMED or DEMED. Two zinc(II) ions in 1 or 2 are coordinated through four nitrogen atoms of tmtaa and a nitrogen atom of the diamine to form two Five-coordinated dinuclear complexes of square-pyramidal geometry. The spectra of 3 are very similar to those of 1 and 2, so the structure of 3 should be analogous to those of 1 and 2. The coordination behavior of the diamine at the axial sites the tmtaa zinc(II) complexes is also discussed. (C), 2003 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Syntheses, characterization and crystal structures of diamine-bridged dinuclear 5,14-dihydro-6,8,15,17-tetramethyldibenzo[b,i][1,4,8,11]tetraazacyclotetradecinatoznc(II) complexes

description.en: A N,N,N',N'-tetramethylethylenediamine (TEMED)-bridged dinuclear tmtaa zinc(II) complex, Zn(tmtaa)(mu-TEMED)(tmtaa)Zn (1) (H(2)tmtaa = 5,14-dihydro-6,8,15,17-tetramethyldibenzo[b,i][1,4,8,11]tetraazacyclotetradecine), a N,N-dimethylethylenediamine (DEMED)-bridged dinuclear tmtaa zinc(II) complex, Zn(tmtaa)(mu-DEMED)(tmtaa)Zn (2) and an ethylenediamine (EDA)bridged dinuclear tmtaa zinc(II) complex, Zn(tmtaa)(mu-EDA)(tmtaa)Zn (3), were prepared by the reactions of Zn(CF3SO3)(2), H(2)tmtaa and TEMED. DEMED or EDA in acetonitrile. 1, 2 and 3 have been characterized by IR spectra, UV spectra, mass spectra, NMR spectra and elemental analyses, as well as DSC measurements. Crystal structures of 1 and 2 were determined by X-ray diffraction. The structures reveal that 1 and 2 are dinuclear tmtaa zinc(II) complexes bridged with TEMED or DEMED. Two zinc(II) ions in 1 or 2 are coordinated through four nitrogen atoms of tmtaa and a nitrogen atom of the diamine to form two Five-coordinated dinuclear complexes of square-pyramidal geometry. The spectra of 3 are very similar to those of 1 and 2, so the structure of 3 should be analogous to those of 1 and 2. The coordination behavior of the diamine at the axial sites the tmtaa zinc(II) complexes is also discussed. (C), 2003 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.ja: Synthesis and spectral properties of iron(Ⅱ), copper(Ⅰ), silver(Ⅰ), and palladium(Ⅱ),complexes of a bidentate Diisonitrile
paper_title.en: Synthesis and spectral properties of iron(II), copper(I), silver(I), and palladium(II) complexes of a bidentate diisonitrile

description.en: The diisonitrile (t-BuDisNC) with two thioether sulfurs in the bridging group has been synthesized in six reaction steps from chlorobenzene. The treatment of iron(II) chloride, silver(I) tetrafluoroborate or sodium tetrachloropalladate(II) with t-BuDisNC yields the corresponding complexes, FeCl2(t-BuDisNC)(2), Ag(t-BuDisNC)(2)BF4, PdCl2(t-BuDisNC), whereas the copper(I) complex, Cu(t-BuDisNC)(2)BF4, is prepared by a ligand exchange reaction. As judged by the molar. conductances. and mass spectra of Cu(t-BuDisNC)(2)BF4 and Ag(t-BuDisNC)(2)BF4, the tetrafluoroborate anion is ionized in acetonitrile. The strong band at 2110 cm(-1), which is correlated with the NdropC stretching mode, shifts to higher energy upon the inductive effect of the metal ion. The methylene proton signal in the bridging group is scarcely shifted on metal coordination. These data show that the NdropC group in the complexes serves as a a-donor and the thioether sulfur is not coordinated to the metal atom.

publication_name.ja: Synthesis and Reactivity in Inorganic and Metal-Organic Chemistry
publication_name.en: SYNTHESIS AND REACTIVITY IN INORGANIC AND METAL-ORGANIC CHEMISTRY

paper_title.en: Synthesis and spectral properties of iron(II), copper(I), silver(I), and palladium(II) complexes of a bidentate diisonitrile

description.en: The diisonitrile (t-BuDisNC) with two thioether sulfurs in the bridging group has been synthesized in six reaction steps from chlorobenzene. The treatment of iron(II) chloride, silver(I) tetrafluoroborate or sodium tetrachloropalladate(II) with t-BuDisNC yields the corresponding complexes, FeCl2(t-BuDisNC)(2), Ag(t-BuDisNC)(2)BF4, PdCl2(t-BuDisNC), whereas the copper(I) complex, Cu(t-BuDisNC)(2)BF4, is prepared by a ligand exchange reaction. As judged by the molar. conductances. and mass spectra of Cu(t-BuDisNC)(2)BF4 and Ag(t-BuDisNC)(2)BF4, the tetrafluoroborate anion is ionized in acetonitrile. The strong band at 2110 cm(-1), which is correlated with the NdropC stretching mode, shifts to higher energy upon the inductive effect of the metal ion. The methylene proton signal in the bridging group is scarcely shifted on metal coordination. These data show that the NdropC group in the complexes serves as a a-donor and the thioether sulfur is not coordinated to the metal atom.

paper_title.ja: Preparation, spectroscopic properties and characterization of oxovanadium(Ⅳ), isothiocyanoto-manganese(Ⅲ), cyanocobatt(Ⅲ) and cobalt(Ⅱ)complexes with a-bis-crown ether tetmaza[14]annulene
paper_title.en: Preparation, spectroscopic properties and characterization of oxovanadium(IV), isothiocyanato-manganese(III), cyanocobalt(III) and cobalt(II) complexes with a bis-crown ether tetraaza[14]annulene

description.en: Oxovanadium(IV), isothiocyanatomanganese(III), cyanocobalt(III) and cobalt(II) complexes of tetra-aza[14]annulene appended with two crown ethers at 2,3- and 11,12-positions have been prepared. Cation complexation behavior of these cavity-bearing tetraaza[14]annulene complexes has been investigated by optical absorption methods. The cation K+, which necessitates two crown ether cavities for complexation, induces dimerization of the tetraaza[14]annulene complexes, whereas the Na+ does not. Formation of the sandwich complexes due to dimerization is hindered by the steric interactions involving the axial ligand as judged by the blue shift of the intense band around 385-425nm. Judging from its ESR spectrum, the cobalt(II) complex becomes a monomeric dioxygen complex of a I : I molar ratio in the presence Of O-2 and pyridine at 77 K.

paper_title.en: Preparation, spectroscopic properties and characterization of oxovanadium(IV), isothiocyanato-manganese(III), cyanocobalt(III) and cobalt(II) complexes with a bis-crown ether tetraaza[14]annulene

description.en: Oxovanadium(IV), isothiocyanatomanganese(III), cyanocobalt(III) and cobalt(II) complexes of tetra-aza[14]annulene appended with two crown ethers at 2,3- and 11,12-positions have been prepared. Cation complexation behavior of these cavity-bearing tetraaza[14]annulene complexes has been investigated by optical absorption methods. The cation K+, which necessitates two crown ether cavities for complexation, induces dimerization of the tetraaza[14]annulene complexes, whereas the Na+ does not. Formation of the sandwich complexes due to dimerization is hindered by the steric interactions involving the axial ligand as judged by the blue shift of the intense band around 385-425nm. Judging from its ESR spectrum, the cobalt(II) complex becomes a monomeric dioxygen complex of a I : I molar ratio in the presence Of O-2 and pyridine at 77 K.

paper_title.en: Syntheses and characterization of di- and mono-thiocyanato germanium (IV) complexes with 5,14-dihydro-6,8,15,17-tetramethyldibenzo[b,i][1,4,8,11]tetraazacyclotetradecine

description.en: By controlling the molar ratio of Ge(tmtaa)Cl-2 and NH4SCN at 1:2 and 1:1 in CH3OH (H(2)tmtaa = 5,14-dihydro-6,8,15,17-tetramethyldibenzo[b,i] [1,4,8,11]tetraazacyclotetradecine), two kinds of germanium(IV) complexes, Ge(tmtaa)(NCS)(2) (1) and Ge(tmtaa)(Cl)(NCS) (2), were prepared and characterized by IR, UV, mass and NMR spectra as well as DSC measurements. In the IR spectrum of 1, two C=N stretching bands of NCS groups were observed at 2073 and 2043 cm(-1), while in the IR spectrum of 2, only one C=N stretching band of a NCS group appeared at 2110 cm(-1). The crystal structure of a trans six-coordinate tmtaa complex of germanium in the +IV oxidation state is reported. X-ray single crystal analysis of 1 reveals that it adopts a six-coordinate geometry in which two NCS groups are in trans positions, The bond lengths of Ge-N between the central germanium and NCS groups are 1.996(6) and 2.031(6) Angstrom. They are longer than those between the central metal and nitrogen atoms of tmtaa (1.926 Angstrom). (C) 2002 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Preparation and molecular arrangement of novel pyrenophanes

description.en: A stack and an offset stack geometrical arrangements based on the columnar structure have been confirmed for the molecular packing of novel pyrenophanes consisting of aniline unit or nitrobenzene unit, respectively, in contrast to a herringbone arrangement identified for the pyrenophane having benzene unit. Such a columnar stack arrangement is probably due to weak intermolecular interaction between the pyrene and the opposite aromatic component.

paper_title.en: Synthesis and reaction of novel (tetraaza[14]annulene)nickel(II) complexes with amino groups in their side chains
A facile synthesis of naturally occurring binaphthoquinones: efficient oxidative dimerization of 4-alkoxy-1-naphthols using silver(II) oxide-40% nitric acid

description.en: Oxidation of 4-alkoxy-1-naphthols with AgO-40% HNO3 occurred along with a dimerization to give the corresponding bi-1,40naphthoquinones. The oxidative dimerization required one hydroxyl group and took place at its ortho position. This reaction was applicable to syntheses of naturally occurring binaphthoquinones, bivitamin K-3 and 3,3'-bijuglone. (C) 2002 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Synthesis and spectral properties of 1,8-bridged fluorenophanes consisting of polynuclear aromatic component
Synthesis and crystal structure of a chloro-bridged dinuclear germanium(IV) heterocoordinate complex with 5,14-dihydro-6,8,15,17-tetramethyldibenzo[b,i][1,4,8,11]tetraazacyclotetradecine

description.en: A novel chloro-bridged dinuclear germanium(IV) complex with 5,14-dihydro-6,8,15,17-tetramethyldibenzo[b,i]-[1,4,8,11] tetraazacyclotetradecine has been synthesized and its crystal structure shows an unsymmetrical heterocoordinate dimer which has a five-coordinate square pyramid and a six-coordinate octahedron.

paper_title.en: Syntheses and structures of dichloropalladium(II)(dithia[3.3]metadipyridinophane) and dichloroplatinum(II)(dithia[3.3]metadipyridinophane) complexes

description.en: Dithia[3.3]metadipyridinophane was prepared as a neutral cyclophane type ligand and its structural properties were investigated. Complexation of the ligand with bis(benzonitrile)palladium(II) dichloride or bis(benzonitrile)platinum(II) dichloride gave dichloropalladium(II)(dithia[3.3]dipyridinophane) and dichloroplatinum(II)(dithia[3.3]dipyridinophane) complexes, respectively. The X-ray crystal structure of dichloropalladium(Il)(dithia[3.3]dipyridinophane) revealed a planar four-coordinate configuration with two chloride anions and two N atoms of dithia[3.3]dipyridinophane. Dichloroplatinum(II)(dithia[3.3]dipyridinophane) was also found to form a planar four-coordinate complex surrounded by two N atoms of dithia[3.3]dipyridinophane and two chloride anions. Both crystals include one dichloromethane molecule as solvent of crystallization. (C) 2001 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Synthesis and characterization of 7,16-bis(phenylazo)tetraaza[14]annulenes

description.en: The diazo coupling reaction between a tetraaza[14]annulene (1) and a series of 4-substituted phenyldiazonium tetrafluoroborates yielded the corresponding 7,16-disubstituted products. Mass spectra indicate the presence of molecular ion peaks that substantiate the 7,16-disubstituted products (4); the lack of olefinic proton signals corresponding to the 7,16- position in the H-1 nmr spectra of 4 also show that diazo coupling has taken place. Analysis of signals corresponding to the methyl groups of 4 in their H-1 and C-13 nmr spectra indicate that the imine-bis-hydrazone form is present for compounds that do not contain p-methoxyphenyl groups. However, analysis of methyl signals in the nmr specta of compounds 4 containing p-methoxyphenyl groups show that the bis-azo form and the imine-bis-hydrazone form are present through tautomerism. Complexation with nickel(II) ion induces the formation of the bis- azo structure.

paper_title.en: Conformational properties and intramolecular weak interactions in substituted dithia[3.3.1]metacyclophanes

description.en: Relationship between conformational properties and intramolecular weak interactions of dithia[3.3.1]metacyclophanes carrying a nitro or an amino group on their inner position was studied by H-1 NMR, IR spectra and X-ray structural analyses. It was found out that intramolecular hydrogen-bonding between hydroxy group and one of thr methoxy groups or NH-pi interaction between amino protons and two opposite aromatic rings exerts a major influence on the conformations of these cyclophanes.
